column4: i'm trying to install breezy badger off the cd, but i think there is a driver problem which locks it up, says that it can't use 8139cp and that i should use 8139too instead, but how?
could somebody give me a hand installing breezy off the latest cd?
not that it is recommended, especially not if you need help already
ok, if you think thats the best way
what do you mean? its not recommended to dist-upgrade? i think the installer is just using a wrong driver, but i dont know how to change it
Breezy is not stable, so it can break your entire system
yeah, i realise that, i can fix quite a few things, but no idea how to change the driver
it comes up with an error that says 8139cp not supported, try 8139too
perhaps get the driversoftware from manufacturer, compile and then "modprobe"
in worst case scenario you'll have to recompile the kernel aswell :/
i think i'll wait then... haven't had problems before, so i guess it will be fixed
but your NIC is not working now ?
i think you can try to get the 8139too source/binary and modprobe it
i am using hoary at the moment, and its working fie
oh.. i c.. so why isit complaining? =)
the installer stops at something like "Downloading file 7 of 8"
